clinical_study.brief_title: CLAM Chemotherapy With PBSC Support for Relapsed Patients After Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Salavge Chemotherapy With Cladribine, Cytarabine and Mitoxantrone Followed by Mobilized Peripheral Stem Cell Infusion From the Original Donor for Relapsed Patients After Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplantation: Phase I/II Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: For acute leukemia patients with early relapse after allogeneic stem cell transplantation, the overall outcome is poor. In this study, we evaluate the treatment outcome and safety of chemotherapy with Cladribine, cytarabine and mitoxantrone followed by peripheral stem cell support from the original donor.

detailed_description.textblock: For acute leukemia patients experienced relapse 6 months or less after allogeneic stem cell transplantation, the overall outcome is poor. In this study, we design a treatment protocol aiming to achieve complete remission for this high-risk group of patients with chemotherapy consisting of Cladribine (5mg/m2), cytarabine (1.5g/m2) and mitoxantrone （10mg/m2）for 5 days followed by infusion of mobilized peripheral stem cell from the original donor. For patients who failed to achieved remission,a second cycles will be given. For patients who achieved remission, the post-remission therapy is open depend on patient's intent: consolidation with one more cycle, second allo-HSCT with different donor or continuous DLI.

primary_outcome.description: evaluation of bone marrow 30 days after treatment

secondary_outcome.description: chiremism analysis of patients bone marrow mononucleared cells at day 30 after treatment
bone marrow relapse within 6 months after treatment
patients died due to any treatment complication or other cause except for disease progression or relapse
grade II-IV acute GVHD and cGVHD if presented

arm_group.description: CLAM chemotherapy with mobilized PBSC infusion: Cladribine 5mg/m2 + cytarabine 1.5g/m2 + mitoxantrone 10mg/m2 from D1 to D5

intervention.description: Cladribine 5mg/m2 + cytarabine 1.5g/m2 + mitoxantrone 10mg/m2 from D1 to D5

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with acute leukemia relapsed within 6 months after previous allo-HSCT
- no active GVHD
- mobilized PBSC from the original donor available
Exclusion Criteria:
- ECOG >=3
- liver function/renal function damage (over 2 X upper normal range)
- active infection including CMV and EBV
